intro: Corydalis bulbosa f. capillaris, commonly known as the slender corydalis, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of China. It is a member of the Fumariaceae family and is characterized by its delicate, slender stems and small, lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces clusters of pale pink to purple flowers with two prominent upper petals and two smaller lower petals, typical of the genus Corydalis. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and prefers partial to full shade, often growing in woodland or rocky habitats. This variety is valued for its ornamental appeal and is sometimes cultivated in gardens for its refined floral display.
